page.title: 10SHARESHILL VILLAGE
page.content: Shareshill is a small village lying 6 miles north of Wolverhampton and 4 miles south-west of Cannock.Whilst retaining the agricultural nature of the area it is basically a dormitory village for workers in the West Mid- lands conurbation.The M6 cuts through the N.E.of the area enabling quick and easy travelling from junction ll. Shareshill together with Great and Little Saredon were mentioned in the original Domesday Book.It was recorded that Shareshill was assessed at 3 hides having woods half a mile long and as much broad.A hide is usually taken as l2O acres thus in lO86 the village covered an area of about 36O acres. In l563 there were 3O households,and in l665 79 households.In the census of l98l the population was 72O.
